page.title: 05Parish Council: Duties
page.content: It is the duty of the{Parish {Council}to ensure that{Twyning}is a pleasant village in which to live. The {Parish Council}can pay for anything that is not covered by the{Borough}or {County Council.}Recent examples include:{grass-cutting}of verges and the green; the upkeep of the{church- {yard;}planting three silver birches on the{green;}enlarging the car-park near the{Village Inn}and planning improve- ment for the{Fleet area. } They can raise problems with the higher authorities: such matters as the efficiency of the{sewage disposal {system}and the repair and upkeep of {footpaths}within the parish. The {Parish Council}requested{Gloucester- {shire County Council}to put a handrail on the steep part of the footpath by the{School playing field,}to assist the elderly in the village.
